news_header: The trial of Hadi Matar, accused of stabbing author Salman Rushdie, began in New York. Rushdie was attacked in 2022, leaving him with severe injuries.
news_original_title: What to know about the Salman Rushdie stabbing trial
news_text: The trial of Hadi Matar, a 27-year-old man accused of stabbing British-Indian author Sir Salman Rushdie multiple times in 2022, commenced in upstate New York. Matar faces charges of attempted murder and assault, to which he has pleaded not guilty. The attack occurred at the Chautauqua Institute, where Rushdie was scheduled to give a lecture. Witnesses, including Rushdie himself, will testify in the trial. The author suffered serious injuries, including liver damage and loss of vision in one eye. Matar has a controversial background, including alleged ties to Hezbollah, and has expressed negative views about Rushdie. The trial is highly publicized and could result in a lengthy prison sentence for Matar if convicted.
